abstract: Qwest has upgraded its network in Denver for the Democratic Party convention, adding 3,344 miles of single strands of fiber and 140 miles of copper wire and cable. The aggregate data capacity of Qwest’s network at the convention is about 50 billion bits per second, the company said.
snippet: Qwest has upgraded its network in Denver for the Democratic Party convention, adding 3,344 miles of single strands of fiber and 140 miles of copper wire and cable. The aggregate data capacity of Qwest’s network at the convention is about 50 billio...
lead_paragraph: Denver-based Qwest Communications has been named the “Official Telecommunications Provider” for the Democratic National Convention in Denver and has been preparing for months for this week’s event at the Pepsi Center and Invesco Field at Mile High. In recent months it has upgraded its network there, adding 3,344 miles of single strands of fiber and 140 miles of copper wire and cable. The aggregate data capacity of Qwest’s network at the convention is about 50 billion bits a second, the company said.
